title: Seat Distribution in UK and Nigeria

content.question: Which of the following is a difference in the outcome of the distribution of seats in the United Kingdom and Nigeria in 2018?

choices.label: The majority party in each country controlled the legislature and formed a government which dominated policy-making.
A coalition of political parties governed in the United Kingdom, and a single-party majority controlled the legislature in Nigeria.
In both countries small parties received a large percentage of the vote but were awarded relatively few seats in the legislature.
In the United Kingdom a hung parliament was unable to choose a chief executive, while in Nigeria the APC had a majority and was able to appoint the president.

content.answer: A coalition of political parties governed in the United Kingdom, and a single-party majority controlled the legislature in Nigeria.
